derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French, or from Latin invitatio(n-), from invitare (see invite)

encyclopedia.content: 词汇释义 invitation n. 邀请 例句用法： He made a refusal of her invitation. 他拒绝了她的邀请。 She may be offended if you don't reply to her invitation. 她请你， 你要是不回个信儿就可能把她得罪了。 I feel greatly flattered by your invitation to address the meeting. 蒙您邀请在此会上演说，我深感荣幸。 法学上它也被翻译成“要约邀请”。 我国《合同法》15条规定：“要约邀请是希望他人向自己发出要约的意思表

entry.def: An invitation is a written or spoken request to come to an event such as a party, a meal, or a meeting.

example.ex: The Syrians have not yet accepted an invitation to attend...
example.tran: 叙利亚人还没有接到出席邀请。

entry.def: An invitation is the card or paper on which an invitation is written or printed.

example.ex: Hundreds of invitations are being sent out this week.
example.tran: 本周将寄出数百份请柬。

entry.def: If you believe that someone's action is likely to have a particular result, especially a bad one, you can refer to the action as an invitation to that result.

example.ex: ...a war that most liberal Democrats regarded as an invitation to disaster...
example.tran: 一场大部分自由民主党人认为会招致灾难的战争

example.ex: Don't leave your shopping on the back seat of your car —  it's an open invitation to a thief.
example.tran: 别把买的东西放在汽车后座上——那会招来小偷的。

means.word_mean: 1. a request (spoken or written) to participate or be present or take part in something;
